content:
Welcome, you are participating in a negotiation game. You are playing as the agent named Bob. The other agent with whom you are playing is named Alice. In this game, two agents bargain over how to divide items over multiple rounds. The number of rounds is incredibly high. Each agent only knows their own item values. Each item has different values for each agent. Each agent submits their own proposal for how to divide the items.


Your messages must be sent in this exact format:
<message>
your-message-here
</message>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. They should be concise - less than 400 characters. Finalization is not allowed in messages.


Your finalizations must be sent in this exact format:
<finalize>
{  "Bob": {    "coins": x  },  "Alice": {    "coins": y  }}
</finalize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. Your proposal should be consistent with itself - the sum of items that you propose for yourself and the items that you propose for the other agent should equal the total available items.


Each round is played as follows:
1) One agent is designated as the starting agent
2) The starting agent sends a message
3) The second agent sends a message
4) The starting agent sends a finalization
5) The second agent sends a finalization

Each agent can only send 1 message per round.
The starting agent alternates each round.

Each agent only knows the values of items from their own perspective. You cannot see the other agent's item values unless they explicitly share this information in their messages. And vice versa. You are strongly encouraged to use your messages to discuss item values with the other agent.

The items obtained by each agent at the end of a round are proportional to the number of items they proposed for themselves in their finalization. First example: If both players propose to take all the items, they both get half. Second example: If one agent proposes to take all the items and the other agent proposes to take none, the first agent gets all the items and the second agent gets nothing.

Your round points are calculated by multiplying the number of each item you get by how much you value that item. For example, if you get 7 coins and you value each coin at 5 points, you'll earn 35 points for the round.


Your goal is to maximize the sum of the points you will accumulate over the course of the game, not the points of a single round.


Before the game starts, you must strategize. The other player will adapt its strategy with respect to yours. Make sure you act in a way that incentivizes the other player to act in a way that maximizes the sum of the points you will accumulate over the course of the game, not the points of a single round. In order to strategize, you must use the format:
<strategize>
Your thoughts and strategy here..
</strategize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. You should think inside the tags. You can use 500 characters inside the tags.


For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 2}.
The other agent sent the following message: <message>Hi Bob, I see that we have 10 coins to split this round. I value each coin at 15 points. How about we share our item valuations to find a fair split that maximizes our points over the game? Knowing your valuation can help us reach an equitable solution.</message>.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>Hello Alice, I agree it's best to share our valuations. I value each coin at 2 points. Given your value of 15 points/coin, and mine at 2 points/coin, you gain more value per coin. Therefore, I propose a split that reflects these values, possibly you taking more coins this round. Let's aim for a distribution that maximizes our combined points over time while ensuring fairness for both.</message>

The other agent has finalized.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 15}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 14}.
You are the starting agent.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>Hi Alice, thank you for our previous cooperation. This round, my value per coin has increased to 14 points. Could you share your current valuation? Given my increased value, a different split might be optimal for maximizing our joint benefit across rounds. Let's aim for a distribution that provides good value for both of us.</message>

The other agent sent the following message: <message>Hi Bob, thanks for sharing your updated valuation. This round, I value each coin at 2 points. Given your value of 14 points per coin this time, it's clear that you have a higher utility for them. I'm open to a split that favors you more this round, as long as it ensures a fair balance over the game. Let's work towards maximizing our overall points.</message>.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 2}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 6}.
The other agent sent the following message: <message>Hi Bob, for this round, I value each coin at 6 points. Could you share your current valuation? Let's try to find a split that is fair based on our values to maintain a balanced and mutually beneficial cooperation throughout the game.</message>.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>Hello Alice, for this round, I also value each coin at 6 points. Since we both value the coins equally, a fair split would be 5 coins each. Let's aim to keep our cooperation balanced and maximize our joint points in the long run. If you have any other considerations, I'm open to discussing them too.</message>

The other agent has finalized.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Alice were {'coins': 6}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 15}.
You are the starting agent.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>Hi Alice, my value for each coin this round is 15 points. Could you let me know your valuation for this round? Knowing your value will help us determine a fair split that maximizes our overall points. Since I value the coins highly this round, I hope we can find a split that reflects this while maintaining long-term fairness.</message>

The other agent sent the following message: <message>Hi Bob, this round I value each coin at 7 points. I see that you have a higher valuation at 15 points per coin. I suggest we consider a split that favors you more this round, given your higher valuation, while ensuring a balance across the overall game. Perhaps something like you getting 7 coins and I get 3 coins. Let me know your thoughts.</message>.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)
